results.title: Very important person [Study extract]
results.creator_credit: Ken Annakin, Leslie Parkyn, Julian Wintle, Society for Education in Film and Television and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: An extract from “Very Important Person”, directed by Ken Annakin. Features Farrow’s relations with other prisoners who suspect him of being a spy, his accidental discovery of the escape tunnel, and his encounter with the Camp Commandant on parade. Cast includes James Robertson Justice, Leslie Phillips, Stanley Baxter, Eric Sykes, Richard Wattis.

results.title: Very dangerous
results.creator_credit: James Hamilton, Crawley Films and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film deals with the extent, transmission, symptoms and treatment of gonorrhoea and syphilis. Animated diagrams illustrate the male anatomy and the course of infection. The value of blood tests and early proper treatment are emphasised. Through cooperation with health authorities and with knowledge these very dangerous venereal diseases can be wiped out. Revised version of the Royal Canadian Air Force Film, It’s Up to You (307799)

results.title: Wildside. Eps. 1-2
results.creator_credit: Michael Jenkins, Steve Knapman and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Bill McCoy (Tony Martin) has come back to Sydney after a four year absence, working throughout South East Asia after retiring from the police force due to the level of police corruption and his inability to turn a blind eye. His return is triggered by a phone call from his friend and crisis worker, Syd, that his son Nick is in some kind of trouble. McCoy pays a visit to his ex-wife after having no luck locating Nick, only to be told Nick ended up in a youth detention centre, unbeknownst to Bill - his wife has no idea where their son is. In his venture to locate Nick, Bill meets Dr Maxine Summers (Rachel Blake), who runs a drop in centre for delinquent youth and is treating a young boy named Joe. Joe is a suspect in a ram-raid and car chase that ended with the death of two police officers, while at the same time the body of young boy turns up; tied, raped, tortured and his throat slit.

results.title: Wildlife in the Rockies
results.creator_credit: William H. Carrick, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: After many years of careful conservation, Banff and Jasper National Parks have become vast zoological gardens. Deer, moose, bear, big-horn sheep, birds and small animals that live above the treeline are natural subjects for the close-up camera, with a backdrop of snowy peaks of the Canadian Rockies. Photography: William H. Carrick
results.creator_credit_for_label: William H. Carrick, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Tulip
results.creator_credit: Rachel Griffiths, Louise Smith, Scott Bradley, Helen Campbell, Shaun Farrington and New South Wales Film and Television Office
results.brief_description: William (Bud Tingwell), has just lost his wife, Ruth, after forty-five years of marriage. In the days after her death he tries to adjust to life alone, but must first solve the dilemma of how to milk her cow, Tulip. Music by David Bridie.

results.title: Seeing through commercials
results.creator_credit: Ruth Arens, Larry Stein and Barr Films
results.brief_description: Designed to alert younger children to the techniques and motivations behind television commercials. Shows how close-up shots, camera angles, lighting and special effects can make products seem bigger and more exciting than they really are, and points out how the narration in commercials can be misleading. Also notes how important product information and disclaimers are often included very briefly and subtly at the end of a commercial. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Seeing red: stories of American communists
results.creator_credit: James Klein, Julia Reichert and Heartland Productions
results.brief_description: Compelling Academy Award-nominated documentary providing an oral history account of the American Communist Party from the Great Depression, through McCarthyist demonisation of the 50s, to the early 80s. Employing a wealth of archival material culled from over 400 interview sessions with former and current party members, the film provides a vernacular account of the American Left. Includes footage of speeches made by Ronald Reagan, Richard Nixon, Hubert Humphrey and Joseph McCarthy set the context for the film. The film provides a fascinating vernacular account of the American Left.

results.title: Seeing red and feeling blue
results.creator_credit: Jane Oehr, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Provides basic information about reproduction and aspects of menstruation, and probes emotional responses on many aspects of womanhood. The Women’s Theatre Group of Melbourne performs improvisations and satirical sketches which comment on many of society’s prevailing attitudes towards sex education and women.

results.title: Seeds of discovery
results.creator_credit: Bert Lawrence, National Aeronautics and Space Administration and MRC Films
results.brief_description: An introduction to planetary exploration and scientific satellite research considered for the 1970’s. Briefly describes plans for Mariner flybys of Mars, Pioneer studies of Jupiter, landings of unmanned Viking spacecraft on Mars, a grand tour of the outer planets, and solar and other astronomy research.
